result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominic Charles Bottoni

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dominic Charles Bottoni appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley appeared by video for Dominic Charles Bottoni.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has discovery and requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominic Charles Bottoni appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley appeared by video for Dominic Charles Bottoni.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense Bail Motion on No Contact Order held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies bail modification.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Additional Materials for Bail Hearing

Defendant Dominic Charles Bottoni appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley appeared by video for Dominic Charles Bottoni.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests modification of no contact order.  State requests bail hearing date to comply with victim notification.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominic Charles Bottoni in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominic Charles Bottoni in court with attorney Annette E Rauch on behalf of Christopher Hartley.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominic Charles Bottoni in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JS or child in common.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

The Defendant claimed to have posted bail at this amount with Oak Creek PD. Attorney will obtain proof of posting.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dominic Charles Bottoni in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 35.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominic Charles Bottoni not in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case not on today's calendar. Case called at the State's request to cancel the arrest warrant. Court cancels the arrest warrant. State to issue an order-in date. No future date at this time.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
